author: Vikas Pathak
text:
The top brass of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh is going to be present at Nagaur in Rajasthan through this week, formulating strategies and brainstorming on the key issues facing the country.

From March 11-13, the Akhil Bharatiya Pratinidhi Sabha, the highest decision-making body of the Sangh will meet at the Nagaur.

Leaders from the Sangh Parivar outfits, including the BJP, the student-affiliate Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad, the VHP and other organisations will attend the meet.

Among the issues to be discussed will be proposed changes in the RSS’ uniform. “The meet will also brainstorm on how to respond to the debate on Dalit issues,” said an RSS leader.

The present debate on “nationalists” and “anti-nationalists” in the context of the events at the JNU is also likely to be discussed.
title: RSS gears up for Rajasthan meet
